info.title: 0CodeKit API

post.description: Creates a summary of the given text.

parameters.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

prompt.example: Once upon a time, in a far away land, there lived a young girl who was full of dreams and aspirations. She was passionate about exploring the world and discovering all its secrets. She wanted to see the wonders of the world, to meet new people, to learn new things, and to experience life in all its glory. As a young girl, she often thought of what it would be like to journey to exotic places, to explore the unknown and to find her place in the world. She wanted to be free to make her own decisions, to choose her own destiny, and to be independent. ne day, she decided she was ready to embark on her quest. She packed her bags, said goodbye to her family, and set off on her travels. She went to places she had only dreamed of, and experienced things she had never imagined. She met people from all walks of life, made new friends, and experienced new cultures. She explored the great outdoors and embraced nature in all its beauty. She tried new foods, and found her favorite cuisines. Through it all, she found her own path and discovered her true purpose in life.

id.description: The ID of the generated content.

data.example: A young girl with dreams of exploring the world and experiencing life's wonders embarks on a journey to exotic places. She meets people from different cultures, tries new foods, and enjoys nature's beauty. Throughout her travels, she finds her own path and discovers her true purpose in life.

noheader.description: If this is false, the first line will be interpreted as column names instead of data. Default is false.

trim.description: Whether spaces around column values should be trimmed. Default is true.

ignoreEmpty.description: Whether empty column values should be ignored, instead of being output as empty. Default is false.

json.description: An array of JSON objects parsed from the CSV.

range.description: The range of the generated number.

type.description: The type of generated number. Default is `integer`.

round.description: The number of decimal places the generated number has. This is only used if `type` is `decimal` or `float`.

post.description: Generate random string based on type and length.

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

type.description: Type of randomness. Specifies the character set to use when generating the random string.

length.description:
Type of randomness. Specifies the character set to use when generating the random string. The available types are: 
- **1**: Numbers only (0-9). 
- **2**: Alphabetical characters (both upper and lower case, A-Z, a-z). 
- **3**: Lowercase alphabetical characters only (a-z). 
- **4**: Uppercase alphabetical characters only (A-Z). 
- **5**: Alphanumeric characters with lowercase letters (a-z, 0-9). 
- **6**: Alphanumeric characters with uppercase letters (A-Z, 0-9). 
- **7**: Complex characters including special symbols (e.g., !, @, #, etc.). 
- **8**: Custom character set, which requires a custom array of characters to be provided.

custom.description: An array of custom characters to use for generating the random string. Required if type is set to 8.

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

hue.description: The hue of the generated color. Default is random.

luminosity.description: The luminosity of the generated color. Default is random.

seed.description: A number or string that is used as a seed for the random number generator. By default, no seed is used.

format.description:
The format of the returned color. These are the possible formats:
- `rgb`: `rgb(0, 0, 0)`
- `rgba`: `rgba(0, 0, 0, 0)`
- `hsl`: `hsl(0, 0%, 0%)`
- `hsla`: `hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0)`
- `hex`: `#000000`

Default is `hex`.

alpha.description: A decimal between 0 and 1 that specifies the value of the alpha channel. This is only relevant when using a format with an alpha channel. Default is a random value.

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com.

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com.

amount.description: The amount of users to generate. Default is 1.

parameters.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

algorithm.description: The signature algorithm to use. Default is `none`.

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

verify.description: Whether to verify the JWT. This requires `secret`. Default is `false`.

secret.description: The HMAC secret or PEM-encoded public key.

algorithms.description: The signature algorithms that should be accepted. By default, all algorithms are accepted.

schema.description: The JWT payload.

post.description: Returns a QR code as a PNG image, styled using the provided settings.

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

data.description: The data that should be encoded

width.description: The width of the QR code in pixels. Default is 500.

height.description: The height of the QR code in pixels. Default is 500.

image.description: The URL of the image that should be put in the middle. By default, no image is used. The image covers up part of the QR code, which can only be recovered using error correction.

margin.description: The size of the space between the QR code and the border of the image in pixels. Default is 15.

qrOptions.description: Options for the QR code data.

typeNumber.description: The type of the QR code. This must be an integer between 1 and 40. The number of dots on each side of the QR code is 4 * type number + 17. If the type is too low to encode all data, the request will fail. By default, the QR code is sized as small as possible.

mode.description:
The mode of the QR code. This decides which characters are allowed in the QR code:

- `Numeric`: Only numbers from 0 to 9.
- `Alphanumeric`: Numbers from 0 to 9, latin letters from A to Z (only upper-case), spaces, and the following special characters: $, %, *, +, -, ., /, :.
- `Byte`: Any bytes.

For almost all cases, `Byte` is the correct choice, including for URLs. Default is `Byte`.

errorCorrectionLevel.description:
The error correction level. The higher the level is, the more likely it becomes the QR code can still be read in bad conditions, e.g. bad lighting, shaking, or when part of the code is hidden or destroyed. However, error correction also requires more data to be stored in the QR code, meaning the `typeNumber` will be higher. These are the approximate percentages of data that can be restored with the respective error correction levels:

- `L`: 7%
- `M`: 15%
- `Q`: 25%
- `H`: 30%

Default is `Q`.

imageOptions.description: Options for the image in the center of the QR code.

hideBackgroundDots.description: Whether the dots covered by the image should be hidden. Default is `true`.

margin.description: The size of the empty space around the image in pixels. Increasing the margin will decrease the image size. Default is 0.

dotsOptions.description: Options for the dots that make up most of the QR code.

type.description: The style of the dots. Default is `square`.

color.description: The color of the dots as a hexcode. Can only be used if `gradient` is not used. Default is `#000000`, i.e. black.

gradient.description: Options for a color gradient of the dots. Can only be used if `color` is not used.

type.description:
The type of gradient. This can be one of two options:

- `radial`: The gradient starts at the center of the image and moves outwards.
- `linear`: The gradient starts at one side and moves to the other.

rotation.description: The clockwise rotation of the gradient in degrees. Can only be used when `type` is linear. Default is no rotation.

colorStops.description: The color stops in the gradient.

offset.description: The offset where this color should be used. Must be between 0 and 1.

color.description: The color of this color stop as a hexcode.

cornersSquareOptions.description: Options for the corner squares. This does not influence the smaller dots inside the corner squares.

type.description: The style of the corner squares. Default is `square`.

color.description: The color of the corner squares as a hexcode. Can only be used if `gradient` is not used. Default is `#000000`, i.e. black.

gradient.description: Options for a color gradient of the corner squares. Can only be used if `color` is not used.

type.description:
The type of gradient. This can be one of two options:

- `radial`: The gradient starts at the center of the image and moves outwards.
- `linear`: The gradient starts at one side and moves to the other.

rotation.description: The clockwise rotation of the gradient in degrees. Can only be used when `type` is linear. Default is no rotation.

colorStops.description: The color stops in the gradient.

offset.description: The offset where this color should be used. Must be between 0 and 1.

color.description: The color of this color stop as a hexcode.

cornersDotOptions.description: Options for the corner dots. This does not influence the square border around the corner dots.

type.description: The style of the corner dots. Default is `square`.

color.description: The color of the corner dots as a hexcode. Can only be used if `gradient` is not used. Default is `#000000`, i.e. black.

gradient.description: Options for a color gradient of the corner squares. Can only be used if `color` is not used.

type.description:
The type of gradient. This can be one of two options:

- `radial`: The gradient starts at the center of the image and moves outwards.
- `linear`: The gradient starts at one side and moves to the other.

rotation.description: The clockwise rotation of the gradient in degrees. Can only be used when `type` is linear. Default is no rotation.

colorStops.description: The color stops in the gradient.

offset.description: The offset where this color should be used. Must be between 0 and 1.

color.description: The color of this color stop as a hexcode.

post.description: Decodes a QR code from a URL or buffer and returns the encoded data. The supported file formats are `jpg`, `png`, `bmp`, `tiff`, `gif`.

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

url.description: The URL to the QR code.

buffer.description: The QR code as a Base64-encoded buffer. Can be used instead of `url`.

data.description: The data contained in the QR code.

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

format.description: The generated file type. Default is `svg`.

getAsUrl.description: Whether to get as URL or buffer. Default is buffer.

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

code.description: The code extracted from the barcode.

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

text.example: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.

expression.description: The regular expression to evaluate against the text.

matches.description: The list of matches found in the text.

isValidRegex.description: Whether the provided regular expression was valid.

post.description: Extracts text from body between given start and end markers

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

body.description: Body from which to extract the text

greedy.description: When true, It include start and end marker in result.

caseSensitive.description: When true, It make the body case sensitive.

returnEmptyIfNotFound.description: When true, Return error if markers not found.

post.summary: Extract text from given PDF (Advanced OCR)
post.description: Extracts text and specific data from documents, supporting OCR and specialized workflows.

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com.

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com.

buffer.description: The Base64-encoded buffer. Can be provided instead of `url`.

resultType.description: Result type specifies the output type.

workflow.description: A workflow outlines steps for processing documents, including analysis, extraction, and transformation. It uses unique identifiers to track and retrieve results for each document.

language.description: The language of the uploaded document.

documentType.description: The type of the uploaded document.
